content:
## MARKET OVERVIEW

1. What is the Current Market Regime?
RISK-ON: low volatility and broad participation with Vol: 14.8% and Breadth: 7/8 sectors positive. Market favoring cyclicals and banks as risk appetite is strong.

2. Which sectors are leading?
Energy & Chemicals and Banking & Finance are leading; GUBRF (1W: +22.56% | 1M: +28.35%) ABOVE TREND and HALKB (1W: +10.29% | 1M: +21.48%) ABOVE TREND. Heavy Industry and Transportation also contributing with names like TRMET (1W: +9.49% | 1M: +25.67%) ABOVE TREND and TCELL (1W: +6.52% | 1M: +16.55%) ABOVE TREND.

3. Which sectors are lagging?
Retail & Food is the lone laggard on the week despite strong 1M gains; ULKER (1W: -5.01% | 1M: +17.93%) CORRECTION and CCOLA (1W: -4.79% | 1M: +19.19%) CORRECTION. Watch for profit-taking in high-valuation consumer names.

## STOCK PERFORMANCE

4. Top Performing Stocks?
GUBRF (1W: +22.56% | 1M: +28.35%) ABOVE TREND; HALKB (1W: +10.29% | 1M: +21.48%) ABOVE TREND; TRMET (1W: +9.49% | 1M: +25.67%) ABOVE TREND; OYAKC (1W: +7.81% | 1M: +12.67%) ABOVE TREND; VAKBN (1W: +7.36% | 1M: +15.18%) ABOVE TREND.

5. Worst Performing Stocks?
ULKER (1W: -5.01% | 1M: +17.93%) CORRECTION; CCOLA (1W: -4.79% | 1M: +19.19%) CORRECTION; KONTR (1W: -3.96% | 1M: -18.16%) BELOW TREND; MGROS (1W: -3.23% | 1M: +16.60%) CORRECTION; BIMAS (1W: -2.86% | 1M: +13.86%) CORRECTION.

6. Momentum Stocks?
GUBRF (1W: +22.56% | 1M: +28.35%) ABOVE TREND; HALKB (1W: +10.29% | 1M: +21.48%) ABOVE TREND; TRMET (1W: +9.49% | 1M: +25.67%) ABOVE TREND; ISCTR (1W: +7.19% | 1M: +10.79%) ABOVE TREND; SOKM (1W: +7.01% | 1M: +22.75%) ABOVE TREND.

## SECTOR OUTLOOK

7. Banking Sector Outlook?
Banks are leading the rally — HALKB (1W: +10.29% | 1M: +21.48%) ABOVE TREND, VAKBN (1W: +7.36% | 1M: +15.18%) ABOVE TREND, ISCTR (1W: +7.19% | 1M: +10.79%) ABOVE TREND and AKBNK (1W: +5.27% | 1M: +12.88%) ABOVE TREND. Favored on low vol, improving loan sentiment and strong relative performance.

8. Industrial Sector Outlook?
Heavy industry shows leadership but with dispersion: EREGL (1W: +3.84% | 1M: +12.00%) ABOVE TREND and TOASO (1W: +4.69% | 1M: +22.21%) ABOVE TREND, while FROTO (1W: -0.28% | 1M: +10.11%) CORRECTION and ASELS (1W: -2.75% | 1M: +33.85%) CORRECTION merit watch for mean-reversion or consolidation.

9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?
Energy is the top thematic winner — TRMET (1W: +9.49% | 1M: +25.67%) ABOVE TREND, GUBRF (1W: +22.56% | 1M: +28.35%) ABOVE TREND and TUPRS (1W: +1.48% | 1M: +20.11%) ABOVE TREND. Momentum intact; commodity price moves and refining margins remain primary drivers.

## PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

10. Portfolio Recommendation?
Risk-on stance: overweight Banking & Finance and Energy & Chemicals, add selective Heavy Industry and Transportation exposure; trim high-valuation, short-term underperformers in Retail & Food and weak Technology (KONTR). Keep stops tight on names showing 1W weakness after strong 1M runs.

## NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?
GUBRF (1W: +22.56% | 1M: +28.35%) ABOVE TREND for momentum continuation; HALKB (1W: +10.29% | 1M: +21.48%) ABOVE TREND for bank flow; TRMET (1W: +9.49% | 1M: +25.67%) ABOVE TREND and SOKM (1W: +7.01% | 1M: +22.75%) ABOVE TREND for earnings/volume cues. Monitor KONTR (1W: -3.96% | 1M: -18.16%) BELOW TREND for downside risk.

12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?
Energy & Chemicals and Banking & Finance for continuation of leadership; Retail & Food for potential catch-up or further profit-taking. Watch Transportation for sensitivity to travel demand data.

13. Key Levels & Triggers?
Watch XU100 reaction to global risk sentiment and domestic rate guidance; support sits at the recent weekly consolidation low and the 50-day moving average, resistance at YTD highs — breaches will dictate follow-through. Key catalysts: CBRT commentary, US real rates, commodity price moves and Q4 corporate updates.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Low-volatility, risk-on market with 7/8 sectors positive; Energy & Chemicals and Banks are the clear leaders while Retail shows short-term weakness. Overweight cyclicals and banks, monitor earnings and macro triggers for signs of rotation or profit-taking.
